title: President Trump on Thursday led leaders of the world’s biggest technology companies in a version of his cabinet meetings, in which each participant takes a turn thanking and praising him
summary: Mark Zuckerberg, Sundar Pichai and Sam Altman saluted the president’s leadership on innovation at an event that underscored the industry’s desire for his favor.

title: President Trump is expected to sign an executive order Friday to rebrand the Department of Defense as the Department of War, reviving a name that was last used in 1947
summary: White House says the name conveys a message of readiness.

title: At Harvard, Judge’s Ruling on Funding Gives Students One More Thing to Ponder
summary: Many students were cautiously hopeful after a judge said the Trump administration could not freeze research funding to the university. But they also had other things on their minds.

title: Adams Considers Dropping Out of Race After Secret Meeting in Florida
summary: Mayor Eric Adams of New York City has told confidants that he would consider abandoning his re-election bid. President Trump said he favored a “one on one” mayoral race.

title: Giorgio Armani’s Life in Photos
summary: One of the most prolific fashion designers in history, he turned a certain kind of Italian chic into an international phenomenon.

title: Kennedy Sounded Different on Agriculture Than He Did on Vaccines
summary: Unlike his combative exchanges with senators about vaccines, Robert F. Kennedy Jr. was conciliatory and accommodating about agriculture interests.

title: Pennsylvania Couple Kept 5 Children in ‘Deplorable’ Conditions, Police Say
summary: The children, between the ages of 5 and 14, were locked in a room that the authorities said “functioned as a dungeon,” with no beds and boarded-up windows.

title: Trump Is Renaming the Defense Department the Department of War
summary: The president is turning back the clock to the name the agency held until shortly after World War II.

title: Trump Administration to End Security Programs Protecting European Allies From Russia
summary: Ending the longstanding program is expected to impact hundreds of millions of dollars that have gone toward countries that border Russia.

title: N.Y.C. Elections Board May Block Ballot Proposals on Housing
summary: The City Council opposes the measures, which would curtail its power. The Board of Elections, appointed by the Council, could prevent voters from weighing in.

title: Trump Claims the Power to Summarily Kill Suspected Drug Smugglers
summary: The move to treat criminals as if they were wartime combatants escalated an administration pattern of using military force for law enforcement tasks at home and abroad.

title: President Trump was within his authority when he ordered the U.S. military to destroy a vessel in the Caribbean, administration officials say. But legal experts and some lawmakers dispute that claim
summary: Legal experts said the president exceeded his legal authority by using lethal military force against a target that posed no direct danger to the U.S.

title: College Board Cancels Tool for Finding Low-Income High Achievers
summary: After the Trump administration criticized the use of what it called “racial proxies,” the group behind the SAT shut down a way for universities to identify promising applicants from disadvantaged communities.

title: U.S. Agents Raid Upstate N.Y. Plant and Detain More Than 70 Migrants
summary: Local law enforcement officers helped federal agents carry out an immigration raid near Syracuse. Witnesses said the agents used police dogs in the raid and wielded crowbars to gain entry.

title: Trump Officials Ask Military Lawyers to Serve as Immigration Judges
summary: Emails sent out call for volunteers to take six-month assignments hearing asylum and deportation cases.

title: A Novelist Asks: Am I Bob Dylan’s Son?
summary: In his autobiographical novel, Sam Sussman grows up wondering if his affinity for the great singer-songwriter goes beyond a striking resemblance.

title: New Congressional Map Clears First Hurdle in Missouri
summary: A legislative committee took a first step to redraw the state’s congressional map in a Republican effort to gain a new seat.

title: Melania Trump Has a Warning for Humanity: ‘The Robots Are Here’
summary: The first lady has shown herself to be captivated by the wonders and dangers and opportunities of modern technologies.

title: Barneys’ Gene Pressman Remembers Giorgio Armani
summary: Fred Pressman respected no brand as much as the ultimate brand: quality. And that, Giorgio delivered in spades.

title: Giorgio Armani’s Designs Changed How People Dress. Twice.
summary: The designer’s innovations — for the chief executive and the celebrity — made Armani a household name.

title: Opinion | Harvard’s Pyrrhic Legal Victory
summary: A judge says Trump’s funding freeze broke the law, but he won’t quit.

title: Opinion | RFK Jr.’s Operation Warped Memory
summary: The health secretary can’t keep his vaccine story straight.

title: Opinion | A Mail-Vote Job for Josh Shapiro
summary: Pennsylvania’s undated ballots are still disputed after years of lawsuits.

title: Opinion | The Wrong Way to Help Farmers
summary: To ease tariff pain in the Farm Belt, Trump is escalating on the ethanol mandate that will raise fuel costs for everyone else.

title: 5 Takeaways From RFK Jr.’s Senate Hearing
summary: During often tense exchanges, Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. defended his positions on Covid vaccines, the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention and autism.

title: Appeals Court Says ‘Alligator Alcatraz’ Detention Center Can Stay Open
summary: An appeals panel paused a federal judge’s ruling that no additional detainees could be sent to the center, and that much of it had to be dismantled within 60 days.

title: Senators Grilled R.F.K. Jr. On Vaccines
summary: Plus, the life of Giorgio Armani. Here’s the latest at the end of Thursday.

title: Time Is Running Out for Lebanon to Disarm Hezbollah, U.S. Officials Warn
summary: The United States, Israel and the Gulf Arab states are pressuring Lebanon’s government to act decisively against the group.

title: After Boat Strike, Rubio Says U.S. Will Help Other Nations ‘Blow Up’ Crime Groups
summary: The Trump administration aims to carry out more violent strikes against drug cartels, Secretary of State Marco Rubio said as he met with Ecuador’s president.

title: Women fleeing domestic abuse overseas will have a tougher time obtaining asylum in the U.S., under decisions this week by Attorney General Pam Bondi
summary: Attorney General Pam Bondi, in her role as the head of the immigration-court system, intervened in several cases to alter the criteria for granting asylum.

title: Kavanaugh Acknowledges ‘Difficult Job’ of His Lower-Court Colleagues
summary: Speaking at a judicial conference in Memphis, the justice expressed sympathy for the district-court judges whose rulings the Supreme Court has repeatedly paused.

title: D.C. Attorney General Sues to Stop Trump’s National Guard Deployment
summary: The District of Columbia’s attorney general is suing to end the deployment of the National Guard in Washington, two days after a federal judge ruled the Trump administration’s use of troops in Los Angeles had been unlawful.

title: RFK Jr. Faces Senate Grilling After Vaccine Changes and C.D.C. Shake-Up
summary: A three-hour hearing before the Senate Finance Committee revealed that the health secretary was on uncertain ground even with some Republicans who voted to confirm him.

title: Quakes on Mars Reveal New Features of the Planet’s Interior
summary: Using data from NASA’s retired InSight lander, two separate teams of researchers found evidence of a sluggish Martian mantle and a solid inner core.

title: Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. was grilled by lawmakers from both parties over his leadership of the CDC and the future of U.S. vaccine policy at a Senate hearing
summary: The health secretary is grilled by lawmakers from both parties over his leadership of the agency and the future of U.S. vaccine policy.

title: The Florida immigration detention facility known as Alligator Alcatraz can stay open after a federal appeals court put on hold a decision that would have seen much of the facility dismantled
summary: An appeals-court ruling puts on hold a lower-court decision that would have dismantled much of the facility.

title: Harvard Won Its Money Back, but Will It Actually Get It?
summary: A judge ruled that the Trump administration broke the law in canceling billions in federal funds for Harvard. Whether the money is returned matters for the rest of higher education.

title: Justice Department Sues Utility Over Southern California Fires
summary: The suit seeks $77 million from Southern California Edison, alleging its negligence caused the deadly Eaton and Fairview fires.

title: Opinion | ZIP Code Is Destiny? Turns Out That’s Bunk
summary: The neighborhood where a child grows up matters much less to his success than what his parents do.

title: Portugal Searches for Cause of Lisbon Funicular Crash as Death Toll Rises
summary: The crash, at a popular tourist site, killed at least 16 people. The authorities were working to identify the victims, who included an American citizen.

title: Opinion | RFK Jr.’s Goat Rodeo
summary: Trump’s cabinet members tirelessly serve his agenda—except this one.

title: Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr’s expansive moves to remake American healthcare were dissected by a skeptical Senate committee on Thursday. Here’s what to know.
summary: Republicans signaled growing concerns over Kennedy’s changes to vaccine policy during his appearance before a Senate committee.

title: Northwestern University President Steps Down Amid Trump Pressure
summary: Michael Schill is the latest university leader to depart during higher education turmoil.

title: Giorgio Armani, Italian Fashion Designer, Dies at 91
summary: He created a male uniform whose feminized form won favor with women. An alliance with movie stars made his name all but synonymous with red-carpet dressing.

title: President of Northwestern, a School Attacked by the G.O.P., Will Resign
summary: The university’s president, Michael Schill, said he would step down following months of turbulence, including Trump administration cuts of $790 million from the university’s research funds.

title: The Justice Department opened a criminal investigation into Fed governor Lisa Cook, issuing subpoenas as part of an inquiry into whether she submitted fraudulent information on mortgage applications
summary: The probe centers on whether the Fed governor submitted fraudulent information on mortgage applications.

title: After Afghanistan Earthquake, Women Tell of Being Shunned by Male Rescuers
summary: A prohibition on contact between unrelated women and men meant many women’s wounds went untended and some were left trapped under rubble after a deadly earthquake, witnesses said.

title: Could a Pill Fix the Brain?
summary: Neurologists are exploring medications that would help the brain recover after a stroke or traumatic injury.

title: What U.S. Open Rivals Alcaraz and Sinner Can Teach Us About Performing Our Best
summary: The top-ranked tennis players may meet again in the U.S. Open men’s final. Here’s what the fierce competitors can teach you about unlocking your potential.

title: Benjamin Franklin arrived in France in 1776 to raise money to help the U.S. survive the war. How he pulled it off is a master class in diplomacy.
summary: He led the effort to raise the money the fledgling country needed to survive and win the war. It’s hard to imagine anybody else could have succeeded.

title: Who Are the Five New ‘S.N.L.’ Cast Members Joining Season 51?
summary: Please Don’t Destroy will stop making videos for the show as Ben Marshall joins the cast. Watch clips of him and the other new additions.

title: U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services is forming its own police force, as President Trump’s immigration crackdown widens beyond traditional law-enforcement agencies
summary: U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services agents will now be allowed to arrest people for immigration violations.

title: The Trump administration asked the Supreme Court late Wednesday to quickly hear its appeal of a ruling that rejected the president’s sweeping global tariffs
summary: The Treasury secretary in a court submission said the lower-court loss is already hurting trade negotiations.

title: Trump Administration’s Cuts to Harvard Funding Are Unconstitutional, Judge Rules
summary: The White House vowed to appeal after a court ordered the government to restore billions of dollars in funding.

title: Google Ruling Shows Antitrust Tools Struggle to Keep Up With Tech Markets
summary: The marketplace moves faster than the legal system, and judges are skittish about crafting industry rules.

title: What Is College Like for You?
summary: Higher education is in flux, and students are adjusting to a lot of changes.
